description: Mango chutney is a sweet and tangy condiment made with ripe mangoes, sugar, vinegar, and spices. It's a versatile accompaniment that adds a burst of flavor to sandwiches, curries, grilled meats, and more.
steps: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions, grated ginger, and minced garlic to the saucepan. Saute until onions are soft and translucent.
Add diced mangoes, brown sugar, white vinegar, raisins, red chili flakes, salt, and water to the saucepan. Mix well.
Simmer the mixture over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until the mangoes are soft and the chutney thickens. This may take about 15-20 minutes.
Once the chutney reaches the desired consistency, remove it from heat and let it cool to room temperature.
Transfer the mango chutney to sterilized jars and store them in the refrigerator.
Enjoy your homemade mango chutney as a condiment with your favorite dishes!
